'''Andreas Möhn''' (born [[1964]]) is a German freelance writer and editor. He first used the pseudonym "Lalaith"<ref>{{webcite|author=Lalaith|articleurl=https://www.otherminds.net/downloads/other-hands/other-hands-issue-15-and-16-magazine.pdf/view|articlename=The indigenous Population of Eriador and Gondor|dated=January 1997|website=otherminds.net|accessed=24 January 2021}}, p. 28 e-mail address on top</ref>   and now uses the pseudonym "Codex Regius" together with his wife, Metka Klemenčič.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://www.amazon.de/Codex-Regius/e/B00J8NAG2W?ref=sr_ntt_srch_lnk_3&qid=1611506881&sr=8-3|articlename=Entry for the author Codex Regius on www.amazon.de|dated=|website=amazon.de|accessed=24 January 2021}}</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://blog.xinxii.de/10-fragen-an-codex-regius/|articlename=10 Fragen an ... Codex Regius|dated=2 December 2013|website=blog.xinxii.de|accessed=24 January 2021}}</ref>

He has an on-line presence concerning the study of [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]'s [[Arda]] by participating on the [[Tolklang]] and [[Tolkien Mailing List]]s. His website, ''[http://lalaithmesp.blogspot.com Lalaith's Middle-earth Science Pages]'', is centred on more obscure aspects of the [[legendarium]] and scientific reasoning on several information Tolkien gives out. His essays concern [[Mannish]] tongues, calendaric calculations, and various geographical topics of [[Arda]].

In October [[2014]] some of the articles were removed from the site, and were updated and provided as purchasable books. By [[2016]] the Science Pages were moved to another site as blog articles. The content of the books about Middle-earth largely replicates the articles from Lalaith's Middle-earth Sciences page.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Middle-earth-seen-barbarians-Full-colour-collective-ebook/dp/B09PGFCYHM/ref=sr_1_1?crid=1CHKSKMEARXNS&dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.pKFgjjbPlFiq_ufKY4Kg4A.kCjmayXnZb9nCq2ylnJjzYq_QXqfFVfMVzJQs0hpYes&dib_tag=se&keywords=Middle-earth+seen+by+the+barbarian&qid=1721380802&s=books&sprefix=middle-earth+seen+by+the+barbarian%2Cstripbooks%2C96&sr=1-1-catcorr|articlename=Middle-earth seen by the barbarians: The complete collection including a previously unpublished essay|dated=|website=amazon.co.uk|accessed=19 July 2024}}</ref>
